answers.author: Katie Wilken
answers.text:
You can't prohibit signs just for churches. You probably either need to create regulations for directional signs or prohibit all signs from being placed in the ROW. Regulating signs is complex, you might want to visit www.planning.org and find some of their model sign ordinances. They also have a great bookstore. Your state's planning association may have some good resources as well.
We prohibit signs in the ROW with a simple regulation that states "signs shall not be placed within the City right-of-way" and then we make an exception for government use signs such as bus bays and welcome signs.

answers.author: Derek Johnson
answers.text:
Tina, 
The size, placement and duration of placement for church signs are often determined at the behest of the town board of commissioners. 
For example, this ordinance from the town of Vestal, NY puts church signs erected off church property under the category of "information signs", meaning any sign indicating proximity or direction to a noncommercial service, event or activity. These signs are regulated in the following ways:
-all information signs in residential or rural residential districts must obtain permission of the sign review board
-all information signs must not exceed four square feet in size
-In addition to off premise signs, a church may erect one 16 square foot sign on its property
http://bit.ly/bc1sTp
This ordinance from the town of Fuquay-Varina in North Carolina limits the number of signs permitted for houses of worship to 3 and requires each sign to have a sticker indicating it is in compliance with town ordinances.  It also establishes regulations concerning size and distance of every sign to ensure they are not blocking means of ingress or egress. 
http://bit.ly/azq8PL
The City of Branson, Missouri has an ordinance request form specifically designed for church sign permits. The contours of each permit depends on the type of event the church is hosting, where it's located and whether they are charging admission or not. It's worth reading:
http://bit.ly/8ZdDKY
Hope this helps you get started!
Derek Johnson

author: Tina Presley
text: We are looking to control the amount of directional signs placed in our Town right-of-way for our local churches. Does anyone have an ordinance in their Code Books or policy that could assist us in any way?
title: church directional signs
